assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. DNANexus 1.9.0; FALCON-Unzip v. DNANexus 1.0.6; purge_haplotigs v. v1.0.3+ 1.Nov.2018; scaff10x v. 4.1.0; Bionano Solve DLS v. 3.2.1; Salsa HiC v. 2.2; Arrow smrtanalysis Pacbio polishing & gap filling v. 6.0.0.47841; longranger align v. 2.2.2; freebayes Illumina polishing v. 1.3.1; gEVAL manual curation v. 2019-10-08; VGP assembly pipeline v. 1.5

bioprojects.title: Geothlypis trichas (Common yellowthroat) genome, bGeoTri1, alternate haplotype

description.comment: The Common yellowthroat (Geothlypis trichas) is a North American warbler songbird, that breads in the US and Canada and winters in Mexico. The species is commonly studied for sexual selection, extra-pair mating, and conservation. This sample was collected by Peter Dunn of the University of Wisconsin, and sequencing supported by him and by Piotr Minias to generate a high-quality reference genome as part of the G10K-VGP.
description.title: Animal sample from Geothlypis trichas

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Common yellowthroat sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate haplotype of the diploid genome Geothlypis trichas. The principal haplotype sequences are in WGS project WSPJ00000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
